Class Google::Pane
In: slices/google_maps/google/pane.rb
Parent: MapObject

Represents a pane that can be added to the map using Map#add_pane. Useful when building your own map controls that contain html.

Methods

new   replace_html  

Public Class methods

new(options = {})

Options:

  • text - Optional
  • partial - Optional
  • css_class, Optional, defaulted to ‘pane’.
  • anchor - Optional, defaulted to top_left
  • offset - Optional, defaulted to [10, 10]

[Source]

    # File slices/google_maps/google/pane.rb, line 15
15:     def initialize(options = {})
16:       options.default! :var => 'pane', :css_class => 'pane', :anchor => :top_left,
17:                        :offset => [10, 10]
18: 
19:       super
20: 
21:       pane_options = {}
22: 
23:       pane_options[:id] = self.var.to_s
24:       pane_options[:position] = OptionsHelper.to_google_position(options)
25:       pane_options[:text] = OptionsHelper.to_content(options)
26:       pane_options[:css_class] = options[:css_class].to_s
27: 
28:       if create_var?
29:         google_options = pane_options.to_google_options(:dont_convert => [:position])
30:         self << "#{self.var} = new GooglePane(#{google_options});"      
31:       end
32:     end

Public Instance methods

replace_html(options)

Replaces the html of the pane. Works in the same way as JavascriptGenerator#replace_html 

 pane.replace_html "This is new html"
 pane.replace_html :text => "This is new html"
 pane.replace_html :partial => 'new_html'

[Source]

    # File slices/google_maps/google/pane.rb, line 39
39:     def replace_html(options)
40:       text = options.extract(:text) if options.is_a?(Hash)
41: 
42:       self.script.replace_html self.var, text || options
43:     end
